page.title: 01Eglwysbach-General Review
page.content: Eglwysbach is a small village in the Conwy Valley in Gwynedd. To the north, the nearest big town is Llandudno whilst to the south, there is the small town of Llanrwst. The village itself is in the valleys of the Rivers Hiraethlyn and Carrog. After the Ice Age the valleys were occupied by a glacial lake which later drained into the Conwy River. About 1000 people live in the village. Until 1945 most of the villagers were Welsh-speaking but today the population is equally divided between Welsh and English speaking. Today it is a dormatory village, with many people travelling to Colwyn Bay, Llandudno and Llandudno Junction, and dominated by farming. The biggest landowner is the Bodnant Estate. Many thousands visit the famous Bodnant Gardens. Many farms are over 400 years old.
